title: Relates to the living wage adjustment of personal care services workers
summary: Relates to the living wage adjustment of personal care service workers; authorizes the commissioner to adjust personal care services medical assistance rates of payment for personal care service providers; provides for such adjustments to be subject to subsequent adjustment or reconciliation in accordance with the local living wage law or are located within a city with a population of over one million persons which has enacted a local living wage law that applies to such persons; defines local living wage law.

       AN ACT to amend the social services law and chapter 1  of  the  laws  of
         2002,  amending the public health law, the social services law and the
         tax law relating to the Health Care Reform Act of 2000, in relation to
         the living wage adjustment for personal care services workers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The social services law is amended by adding a new section
    2  367-x to read as follows:
    3    S 367-X. PERSONAL CARE SERVICES WORKERS; LIVING WAGE ADJUSTMENT.    1.
    4  THE COMMISSIONER OF HEALTH SHALL, SUBJECT TO THE AVAILABILITY OF FEDERAL
    5  FINANCIAL  PARTICIPATION,  ADJUST PERSONAL CARE SERVICES MEDICAL ASSIST-
    6  ANCE RATES OF PAYMENT ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THIS  TITLE  FOR  PERSONAL
    7  CARE SERVICES PROVIDERS LOCATED IN LOCAL SOCIAL SERVICES DISTRICTS WHERE
    8  SUCH  SOCIAL  SERVICES  DISTRICTS  ARE LOCATED WITHIN A COUNTY WHICH HAS
    9  ENACTED A LOCAL LIVING WAGE LAW THAT APPLIES TO  SUCH  SERVICES  OR  ARE
   10  LOCATED WITHIN A CITY WITH A POPULATION OF MORE THAN ONE MILLION PERSONS
   11  WHICH HAS ENACTED A LOCAL LIVING WAGE LAW THAT APPLIES TO SUCH SERVICES.
   12  ADJUSTMENTS  SHALL BE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH SUBDIVISIONS TWO AND THREE
   13  OF THIS SECTION.
   14    2. ADJUSTMENTS TO RATES OF PAYMENT UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL  BE  ALLO-
   15  CATED  BASED  ON  THE  DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE RATE OF HOURLY PAYMENT FOR
   16  PERSONAL CARE SERVICES WORKERS PRIOR TO AN ADJUSTMENT AND  THE  RATE  OF
   17  HOURLY  PAYMENT  THAT  WOULD BE REQUIRED TO COMPLY WITH THE LOCAL LIVING
   18  WAGE LAW.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00902-01-1

       A. 80                               2

    1    3. ADJUSTMENTS UNDER THIS SECTION, UPON APPLICATION BY A LOCAL  SOCIAL
    2  SERVICES  DISTRICT,  SHALL BE SUBJECT TO SUBSEQUENT ADJUSTMENT OR RECON-
    3  CILIATION FOR PURPOSES OF MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE  WITH  A  LOCAL  LIVING
    4  WAGE LAW.
    5    4.  PERSONAL  CARE  SERVICES  PROVIDERS THAT HAVE THEIR RATES ADJUSTED
    6  UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL USE THE INCREASED  FUNDS  FOR  THE  PURPOSE  OF
    7  PAYING  A  STATUTORILY-MANDATED  LIVING WAGE TO NON-SUPERVISORY PERSONAL
    8  CARE SERVICES WORKERS ONLY AND SHALL NOT USE THE  FUNDS  FOR  ANY  OTHER
    9  PURPOSE.    EACH SUCH PERSONAL CARE SERVICES PROVIDER SHALL SUBMIT, AT A
   10  TIME AND IN A MANNER TO BE DETERMINED BY THE COMMISSIONER OF  HEALTH,  A
   11  WRITTEN  CERTIFICATION ATTESTING THAT SUCH FUNDS WILL BE USED SOLELY FOR
   12  THE PURPOSE OF PAYING A STATUTORILY-MANDATED LIVING WAGE  IN  ACCORDANCE
   13  WITH  A LOCAL LAW TO NON-SUPERVISORY PERSONAL CARE SERVICES WORKERS. THE
   14  COMMISSIONER OF HEALTH IS AUTHORIZED TO  AUDIT  EACH  SUCH  PROVIDER  TO
   15  ENSURE  COMPLIANCE  WITH  THIS  SUBDIVISION  AND  SHALL RECOUP ANY FUNDS
   16  DETERMINED TO HAVE BEEN USED FOR PURPOSES OTHER THAN PAYING A STATUTORI-
   17  LY-MANDATED LIVING WAGE TO NON-SUPERVISORY PERSONAL CARE SERVICES  WORK-
   18  ERS.  SUCH  RECOUPMENT  SHALL  BE  IN  ADDITION  TO  ANY OTHER PENALTIES
   19  PROVIDED BY LAW.
   20    5. FOR SOCIAL SERVICES DISTRICTS WHICH INCLUDE A  CITY  WITH  A  POPU-
   21  LATION  OF  MORE THAN ONE MILLION PERSONS ADJUSTMENTS UNDER THIS SECTION
   22  SHALL BE MADE PURSUANT  TO  MEMORANDUM  OF  UNDERSTANDING  ENTERED  INTO
   23  BETWEEN THE STATE OF NEW YORK AND THE LOCAL SOCIAL SERVICES DISTRICT.
   24    6.  ADJUSTMENTS  UNDER  THIS SECTION SHALL BE EFFECTIVE FOR PERIODS ON
   25  AND AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF A LOCAL LIVING WAGE LAW.
   26    7. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "LOCAL LIVING WAGE LAW" MEANS ANY
   27  LOCAL LAW OR, WHEN AUTHORIZED, LOCAL RESOLUTION THAT REQUIRES  A  COUNTY
   28  OR  UNIT  OF  LOCAL GOVERNMENT TO INCLUDE IN ANY CONTRACT FOR SERVICES A
   29  SPECIFIED MINIMUM HOURLY RATE OF PAYMENT  COMMONLY  KNOWN  AS  A  LIVING
   30  WAGE.
   31    S  2.  Section  4 of part A of chapter 1 of the laws of 2002, amending
   32  the public health law, the social services law and the tax law  relating
   33  to  the Health Care Reform Act of 2000, as amended by section 27 of part
   34  J of chapter 82 of the laws of 2002, is amended to read as follows:
   35    S 4. Notwithstanding any law, rule or regulation to the contrary,  the
   36  provisions of section 36 of chapter 433 of the laws of 1997, as amended,
   37  shall  have no force or effect with regard to Medicaid funds received by
   38  providers of personal care services pursuant to section 367-q  OR  367-X
   39  of  the social services law or pursuant to paragraph (bb) of subdivision
   40  1 of section 2807-v of the public health law, or by  providers  of  home
   41  care  services  pursuant  to subdivision 8 of section 3614 of the public
   42  health law.
   43    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
